title: v2 has no success criteria — only a phase map
issue: v2 removes the explicit success criteria section present in v1 and replaces it with a Phase Map that shows status but not completion gates. There is no document-level success gate answering: 'How do we know v2 requirements are correctly implemented?'

title: Open question on ground truth size left unresolved — blocks Phase 1 scope definition
issue: Open Question 3 asks whether 10 validated Critical findings are sufficient for Phase 1 or whether Important findings should be added. This is not deferrable — it directly determines Phase 1 scope. Leaving it open makes the Phase 1 acceptance criteria for FR-ARCH-1 untestable.

title: Assumes agent files are already eval-compatible without modification
issue: FR-ARCH-2 requires agents to work in eval context without modifications to the agent file, but there is no audit step verifying this. If any agent instructs the model to use tools (Read, Glob, etc.), those calls will silently fail in the eval context and produce no output, making the eval invalid.

title: Phase 1 completion has no measurable success criterion
issue: 'Non-zero accuracy' is not a threshold — it could mean 1 finding detected out of 10. Phase 1 never formally completes and Phase 1.5 has no baseline to compare against.
